evidence: The next key idea is back-projection, which is the standard method for reconstructing CT slices.
we start with the sinogram, which contains all the projection data.
we back-project it-that means we spread that projection back across the image space
When we combine them, the overlap starts to suggest the locations
combine back-projections gradually approximate the true shapes

triples.evidence: Standard method of reconstructing CT slices

concepts.term: with enough views, the reconstruction recovers the original sample very accurately

triples.evidence: Standard method of reconstructing CT slices
When we back-project this data, we get a blurry reconstruction along that one angle.
